achievements.comment: Reach EQ3 (TL40)

achievements.name: Destiny Beckons (III)

achievements.comment: Reach EQ5 (TL60)

achievements.name: Time Enough for Love
achievements.description: Possess 4 Light Cones at Lv. 80
achievements.comment: Reach EQ5 (TL60)
achievements.reference: "Time Enough for Love" is the title of a scifi novel telling the story of Lazarus, who has lived for over 2000 years, becomes weary of life but is persuaded to tell stories of his past. Light Cones are a collection of past stories, so the relation here is pretty cool.

achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL20

achievements.comment: Unlocked at EQ1

achievements.comment: Unlocked at EQ3

achievements.name: My Universities
achievements.description: Reach Character Level 80 with any character
achievements.comment: Reach EQ5 (TL60)
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Childhood's End
achievements.description: Enhance 4 characters to Lv. 80
achievements.comment: Reach EQ5 (TL60)
achievements.reference: "Childhood's End" is a classic scifi novel, famous for it's exploration of profound philosophical and social themes. If something is referencing "Childhood's End", it is likely making a nod towards human evolution, the end of mankind as we know it, and the consequences of utopia.

achievements.name: Path Traces (I)
achievements.description: Activate or level up character Traces 3 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Path Traces (II)

achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: Path Traces (IV)
achievements.description: Activate or level up character Traces 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: I Have Finished The Race
achievements.description: Level up all Traces for a character to the maximum level
achievements.comment: Reach EQ5 (TL60)
achievements.reference: "I Have Finished The Race" is a phrase originally coming from the New Testament of the Bible, and is often interpreted as the Apostle Paul reflecting on his life and achievements as a missionary spreading Christianity. In a broader pop culture context, this phrase often denote completion, perseverance, or having carried out one's duties until the end.

achievements.name: Divine Relics (IV)
achievements.description: Level up a 4-star Relic to Max level
achievements.comment: Max level = 12
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Divine Relics (V)
achievements.description: Level up a 5-star Relic to Max level
achievements.comment: Max level = 15
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Armed to the Teeth
achievements.description: Level up 4 Relics to Lv.15
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Very common English idiom that means to be heavily armed with weapons.

achievements.name: Sovereign Warframe
achievements.description: Equip a character with level 15 5-star Relics in all their Relic slots
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Seems to reference the popular free-to-play mmorpg "Warframe". Warframes are exoskeleton that provides the player with special abilities in combat.

achievements.name: My Heart Lies With the Stars
achievements.description: Launch a journey into the vast Galaxy※ Congratulations! You've boarded the Astral Express!
achievements.comment: Congratulations! You have boarded the Astral Express!
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Everwinter Night
achievements.description: After enduring the snow storm...※ You have arrived at the city named Belobog
achievements.comment: You have arrived at the city of Belobog.
achievements.reference: Possibly influenced by the game "Neverwinter Nights" and is a play on the title to suggest a permanently cold or wintery setting.

achievements.name: Lost World
achievements.description: Discover the secret beneath Jarilo-VI※ There are people living underground...
achievements.comment: There are people living underground...
achievements.reference: Clear reference to Jurassic Park's sequel "The Lost World" where a second island is discovered and largely untouched by humans.

achievements.name: Half the Wizard of Oz
achievements.description: Defeat the tin man and the little girl※ Svarog and Clara became your friends!
achievements.comment: Svarog and Clara became your friends!
achievements.reference: "The Wizard of Oz" is an all time great classic novel. It tells the story of a young girl named Dorothy (in this case Clara) and a group of friends she meets along the way - Scarecrow, Tin Man (Svarog), and Lion.

achievements.name: Winter Is Leaving
achievements.description: Let's change Belobog, starting with me!※ Step One: Defeat Supreme Guardian Cocolia...
achievements.comment: Defeat Supreme Guardian Cocolia...
achievements.reference: "Winter is Coming" is a popular tagline from the "Game of Thrones" series. The tagline "Make Belobog Great Again, Again" spells out MBGAA, which is a reference to the MAGA political slogan.

achievements.name: Sauntering Fox
achievements.description: Diplomacy is but a trade of opinions...※ Confer with the leader(s) of the Xianzhou Luofu
achievements.comment: Confer with the leader(s) of the Xianzhou Luofu
achievements.reference: "Sauntering Fox" is a phrase that doesn't directly reference a specific piece of pop culture. The title might be describing the Foxian leaders as those that walk slowly, in a relaxed manner.

achievements.name: Omniscia Spares None
achievements.description: What goes around comes around. No rogue shall escape capture.※ Successfully capture the Stellaron Hunter Kafka
achievements.comment: Successfully capture the Stellaron Hunter Kafka
achievements.reference: Omniscia is derived from latin roots, potentially meaning "All-knowing" or "Omniscient". The "Spares None" implies a situation where no one is exempt from a certain fate. Combined, "Omniscia Spares None" suggest a context where the all-knowing entity does not exempt anyone from its influence, judgment or consequences.

achievements.name: A Professional Onlooker
achievements.description: When the wind-watcher watches you...※ Find Qingque, who is "working hard" at playing games...
achievements.comment: Find Qingque, who is "working hard" at playing games...
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Prophets Do Not Prophesize
achievements.description: Witness the mystery of the Divination Commission's matrix※ Interrogate Kafka with the Matrix of Prescience, and challenge the divination with this foresight...
achievements.comment: Interrogate Kafka with the Matrix of Prescience...
achievements.reference: An ironic or paradoxical statement since prophets are traditionally known for their role in delivering prophecies. This title might be suggesting a break from tradition.

achievements.name: The Deer Hunter
achievements.description: The furnace undoused, the deer silenced※ Save the Artisanship Commission from the crisis
achievements.comment: Save the Artisanship Commission from the crisis
achievements.reference: While there is a game series called "Deer Hunter" where players take on the role of a hunter to track and hunt down deers... we don't think the title is necessarily referencing that game.

achievements.name: Slayer of a Very "Deer" Friend
achievements.description: Try to walk on the Path of The Hunt...※ Help Xianzhou to defeat the Abomination of Abundance, "Ebon Deer"
achievements.comment: Help Xianzhou to defeat the Abomination of Abundance, "Ebon Deer"
achievements.reference: The title uses the homophones "deer" and "dear" to create a pun. Here, "deer" is substituted for "dear," suggesting a literal deer (Ebon Deer) is involved in the narrative.

achievements.name: Svah Sanishyu
achievements.description: If they come back to life, then just kill them again...※ Defeat the Master of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus
achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: The Imbibitor Lunae Arrives
achievements.description: Sea's Depths Conceal No Stone, Dragon's Breaths Reveal the Moon.※ Witness Dan Heng part the waters in Scalegorge Waterscape
achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: The Arbor Snaps
achievements.description: All plots shall be overturned※ Help Jing Yuan to defeat Phantylia
achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: Unstoppable
achievements.description: Use 4 Ultimates in a row
achievements.comment: Just have everyone charge up their ult meter, and then use them all at once.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Break Till Broken
achievements.description: Inflict Weakness Break 4 time(s) upon the same enemy in a single battle
achievements.comment: Best done against a boss in SimU as they have high health
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Serious Punch
achievements.description: Deal equal to or more than 1000 DMG in a single hit
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: One Punch Man's Saitama signature punch. Saitama is known for defeating any of his enemies with a single punch.

achievements.name: Ki Impact
achievements.description: Deal equal to or more than 20000 DMG in a single hit
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "Ki Impact" often relates to concepts in anime, manga and video games, particuarly those influenced by martial arts and Eastern philosophy. "Ki" refers to the life energy or spiritual energy present in various East Asian traditions. Examples of "Ki Impact" can be found in Dragon Ball, Naruto, and Street Fighter. Another possible connection is that "Ki" can be pronounced "Kai", alluding to [Hon]Kai Impact 3rd.

achievements.name: Annihilation
achievements.description: Deal equal to or more than 150000 DMG in a single hit
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve when fighting the Doomsday Beast in Echo of War. Use Tingyun/Bronya with a Seele/Yanqing/Dan Heng. Don't forget to eat a consumable for some extra Oomph. Or borrow a whale friend's DPS. You can repeat Echo of War for free after your 3 weekly attempts.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Consecutive Normal Punches
achievements.description: Deal 2000 DMG in a single action
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Another One Punch Man reference. Here, Saitama is throwing out multiple punches in quick succession.

achievements.name: Blade of Taixu
achievements.description: Deal 40000 DMG in a single action
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve when fighting the Doomsday Beast in Echo of War. Can eat a consumable for some extra damage.
achievements.reference: Taixu is the name of Sushang's fried chicken phoenix, and could be denoting her physical sword that can summon Taixu.

achievements.name: Reverberating Ruin
achievements.description: Deal 300000 DMG in a single action
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve when fighting the Doomsday Beast in Echo of War. Use Tingyun/Bronya with a Seele/Yanqing/Dan Heng. Don't forget to eat a consumable for some extra Oomph. Or borrow a whale friend's DPS. You can repeat fight Echo of War for free after your 3 weekly attempts.
achievements.reference: "Reverberating Ruin" is a phrase that evokes imagery of destruction and a lasting impact. It suggests a sense of power or force that echoes and resonates, causing widespread ruin or devastation.

achievements.name: Trauma Team Platinum Bundle
achievements.description: An ally heals for more than 8000 HP in a single heal
achievements.comment: This is achieveable but quite difficult. Your best bet is to add a Whale luocha friend and follow the guide on the Completionist discord. We have whale luocha for NA players.
achievements.reference: Cyberpunk 2077 - Trauma Team International (or just Trauma Team) is a megacorporation specializing in medical services. If you have a Platinum Membership, Trauma Team guarantees that an AV with qualified and armed-to-the-teeth personnel will show up at the client's location, no later than three minutes after getting the signal from their biomonitor. Even if it means going to hell and back.

achievements.name: Earthwork
achievements.description: An ally has a combined Shield effect greater than 5000 at any time
achievements.comment: Version 1.1 made this achievement way eaiser to obtain. All you need is a 2.5k+ shield and the Macrosegregation blessing to get this achievement.
achievements.reference: In a military context, "earthwork" can refer to defensive structures or fortifications made from earth materials. These structures, such as trenches, bunkers, or mounds, are built to provide protection or concealment for military personnel or equipment.

achievements.name: A Song of Vice and Dire
achievements.description: Inflict both Burn and Freeze upon 1 enemy at the same time
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve in Simulated Universe with blessings.
achievements.reference: A play on the title "A Song of Ice and Fire", a epic fantasy book series that was adapted into "Game of Thrones". By substituting in "Vice and Dire", the phrase suggests a shift in focus towards darker and morally ambiguous themes. "Vice" typically refers to immoral or wicked behavior, while "Dire" implies a sense of urgency, danger, or extreme circumstances.

achievements.name: Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn
achievements.description: Inflict 4 DoT effects upon 1 enemie(s) at the same time
achievements.comment: Easiest to achieve in Sim U with the Nihility path.
achievements.reference: "Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn" is a fantasy book trilogy and a highly regarded work, praised for its detailed world-building, intricate plot and complex characters. As for the connection to DoT effects... Memory in this context could represent the lingering effect of the damage. Sorrow could mean the negative status effects and decreased performance. And Thorn, likening it to a prick of a thorn that remains embedded and continues to cause pain which cannot be easily mitigated.

achievements.name: Electric Dreams
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies with Lightning Break DMG in a single battle
achievements.comment: Pretty much all robots in Robot Settlement are weak to Lightning BUT the self-destructing robots don't count. There's a pair of robots to the far right of the map that don't explode. There is an extensive guide on this pinned in the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: The title "Electric Dreams" is a play on words, referencing both the electric and futuristic nature of the stories presented in the anthology and the title of Philip K. Dick's influential novel "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?" The series has become a notable reference within the science fiction genre and has garnered a dedicated following among fans of Dick's work and science fiction enthusiasts.

achievements.name: Fahrenheit 451
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies with Fire Break DMG in a single battle
achievements.comment: PRO Tip: 6 Calyx battles in a row is considered "a single battle"
achievements.reference: "Fahrenheit 451" is a dystopian novel referring to the temperature at which paper ignites and burns. The novel is set in a future where books are banned by the government.

achievements.name: Sunstorm
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies with Wind Break DMG in a single battle
achievements.comment: PRO Tip: 6 Calyx battles in a row is considered "a single battle"
achievements.reference: "Sunstorm" is a scifi novel that depicts a catastrophic solar event known as the "sunstorm" that threatens to destroy Earth. As humanity faces imminent destruction, a group of scientists and astronauts embarks on a desperate mission to save the planet. The story combines elements of hard science fiction, adventure, and exploration of human resilience in the face of an impending disaster. Star Rail likens "Wind Break" as an event comparable to a Sunstorm.

achievements.name: The Demolished Man
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies with Physical Break DMG in a single battle
achievements.comment: PRO Tip: 6 Calyx battles in a row is considered "a single battle"
achievements.reference: "The Demolished Man" is a scifi novel set in the future where telepathy is common, and follows the protagonist who plans to commit a murder with the help of an Esper to evade detection. How it relates to "Physical Break" is anyone's guess.

achievements.name: Lightning Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Defeat 20 enemies with Lightning Break DMG
achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.description: Defeat 60 enemies with Lightning Break DMG
achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.

achievements.description: Defeat 60 enemies with Fire Break DMG
achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.

achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.description: Defeat 60 enemies with Wind Break DMG
