achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Physical Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Defeat 60 enemies with Physical Break DMG
achievements.comment: You must defeat the enemy with the "Break" DMG portion from a skill for it to count.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Schrödinger's Other Cat
achievements.description: Inflict 5 Quantum Weakness Breaks in a single battle
achievements.comment: PRO Tip: 6 Calyx battles in a row is considered "a single battle"
achievements.reference: The famous thought experiment "Schrödinger's Cat" was a paradox used to illustrate the principles of quantum superposition and the nature of quantum measurement. "Schrödinger's Other Cat" is a playful twist on this thought experiment. It suggests the existence of an additional cat or alternative scenario beyond the conventional understanding of the original experiment.

achievements.name: The Cold Equations
achievements.description: Inflict 5 Ice Weakness Breaks in a single battle
achievements.comment: PRO Tip: 6 Calyx battles in a row is considered "a single battle"
achievements.reference: "The Cold Equations" is another classic scifi that has been anthologized numerous times. The phrase has been synonymous with the moral dilemmas and harsh realities faced in the pursuit of survival in a cold and unforgiving universe.

achievements.name: Unimaginably Imaginary
achievements.description: Inflict 5 Imaginary Weakness Breaks in a single battle
achievements.comment: You could try to achieve this by borrowing a friend's Welt. Go into a Calyx with imaginary weakness, and bring a Welt friend. Then run 6 battles at once (this is considered a single battle).
achievements.reference: "Unimaginably Imaginary" appears to juxtapose contradictory terms, emphasizing the realm of imagination and the limitless possibilities it holds. Watching Welt summon an actual black hole and only dealing minute damage has me unimaginably imagining things.

achievements.name: Quantum Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Inflict Quantum Weakness Break 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: Enemy is "broken" when their toughness meter hits zero.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Quantum Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Inflict Quantum Weakness Break 300 time(s)
achievements.comment: Enemy is "broken" when their toughness meter hits zero.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Ice Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Inflict Ice Weakness Break 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: Enemy is "broken" when their toughness meter hits zero.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Ice Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Inflict Ice Weakness Break 300 time(s)
achievements.comment: Enemy is "broken" when their toughness meter hits zero.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Imaginary Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Inflict Imaginary Weakness Break 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only possible with Welt for now.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Imaginary Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Inflict Imaginary Weakness Break 300 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only possible with Welt for now.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Preemptive Strike
achievements.description: Defeat 1 enemy with Technique DMG
achievements.comment: Easiest to achieve with Serval in Simulated Universe 1.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Technique Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Defeat 10 enemies with Technique DMG
achievements.comment: Easiest to achieve with Serval in Simulated Universe 1.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Mozambique Drill
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies with follow-up attacks in a single battle
achievements.comment: Units with follow-up attacks include March 7, Clara, Herta, Himeko, Jing Yuan and Yanqing. There is a blessing in Sim U that makes all Ultimates a "follow-up attack".
achievements.reference: The Mozambique Drill is a shooting technique used in firearms training and self-defense. Two shots to the body, and one to the head to quickly incapacitate a threat.

achievements.name: Follow-Up Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Defeat 80 enemies with follow-up attacks
achievements.comment: Units with follow-up attacks include March 7, Clara, Herta, Himeko, Jing Yuan and Yanqing. There is a blessing in Sim U that makes all Ultimates a "follow-up attack".
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Follow-Up Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Defeat 240 enemies with follow-up attacks
achievements.comment: Units with follow-up attacks include March 7, Clara, Herta, Himeko, Jing Yuan and Yanqing. There is a blessing in Sim U that makes all Ultimates a "follow-up attack".
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: A Thousand Cuts...
achievements.description: Defeat 3 enemies using DoT in a single battle
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve with Nihility path in Sim U
achievements.reference: "A Thousand Cuts" refers to a method of inflicting pain or causing harm through a series of small, incremental actions or events (like DoT). It suggests that the cumulative effect of many minor offenses or setbacks can be just as damaging or painful as a single major event.

achievements.name: DoT Breaker (I)
achievements.description: Defeat 80 enemies with DoT attacks
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve with Nihility path in Sim U
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: DoT Breaker (II)
achievements.description: Defeat 240 enemies with DoT attacks
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve with Nihility path in Sim U, along with Sampo/Serval/Hook
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: No Offense
achievements.description: Remove buffs on enemies 5 time(s) in a single battle
achievements.comment: Can be done by Pela or the Light Cone "Return to Darkness". The Engine of Destruction in Echo of War will buff one of it's hand every turn, so you can debuff it 5 times here.
achievements.reference: "No offense" is commonly used as a way to express that the speaker does not mean to cause offense or harm, even though the content of their statement may be perceived as such. In this context, it carries on the double meaning of not allowing the enemy to have added offensive capabilities by removing their buffs.

achievements.name: The Exorcist
achievements.description: Remove debuffs from allies 5 time(s) in a single battle
achievements.comment: Can be done by March 7, Natasha, or blessings in Sim U
achievements.reference: "The Exorcist" is a horror novel that became a cultural phenomenon. A young girl is possessed by a demon and an exorcist is sent to cleanse the girl (i.e remove debuffs).

achievements.name: Perpetual Freezer
achievements.description: Freeze 1 enemies for 3 turns in a row
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve in Sim U with plenty of freeze blessings.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Morituri Te Salutant
achievements.description: Defeat an enemy when a character has less than 1% of HP left
achievements.comment: Can be achieved by RNG with the Galactic Lotto Curio in Sim U. You can also eat food to lose team's HP.
achievements.reference: "Morituri te salutant" is a Latin phrase that translates to "Those who are about to die salute you". It is historically associated with the Roman gladiatorial games, where fighters would address the emperor or the spectators with this phrase before engaging in combat. "Morituri te salutant" has become a widely recognized phrase that represents bravery in the face of adversity or the acknowledgment of a potentially fatal situation.

achievements.name: One on One
achievements.description: Enter combat with 4 character(s) but win with only 1 character(s) still standing
achievements.comment: Can be done by with 3 weak units and 1 strong one.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: All Men Must Die
achievements.description: Receive a killing blow from enemies when at 100% HP
achievements.comment: Bring one weak unleveled unit against a tough enemy.
achievements.reference: "All men must die" is a phrase commonly associated with the fantasy series "Game of Thrones," based on the "A Song of Ice and Fire" novels. In the series, it is a translation of the Valyrian phrase "Valar Morghulis." The phrase is frequently used as a reminder of the impermanence and mortality of all individuals in the story's complex and volatile world.

achievements.name: Energy Grandet
achievements.description: Have a character whose Energy is at 100% at the beginning of a turn for 4 turns in a row
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve with Sim U energy blessings and Tingyun.
achievements.reference: We believe "Energy Grandet" is a Cyno-level pun on "Eugénie Grandet", a novel by Balzac.

achievements.name: Passing as a Flower in the City of the Dead
achievements.description: Revive 2 downed character(s) in a single battle
achievements.comment: 4 sources of revive: Destruction blessing in Sim U that revives 1 character upon death; Abundance Path Resonance; Bailu and Gepard's passive can revive.
achievements.reference: "Passing as a Flower in the City of the Dead" is a scifi short story published in the anthology Universe 14. The story tells the tale of building a space colony for patients with immune-compromised diseases and conditions.

achievements.name: Add Insult to Injury
achievements.description: Deal a total of 20000 DMG to enemies inflicted with Weakness Break in a single battle
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve in Sim U with weakness break blessings.
achievements.reference: "Add insult to injury" is a common idiom used in the English language. It means to worsen or compound an already negative or difficult situation by saying or doing something that further offends, humiliates, or hurts someone. Weakness Break DMG is damage that's usually secondary, as if adding insult to injury to your enemies.

achievements.name: A Casualty of Armors
achievements.description: Receive a total of 10000 DMG on 1 character in a single battle
achievements.comment: Bring one of your weak units into a difficult battle.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Serial Breaker
achievements.description: Inflict Weakness Break to 4 enemies in a single action
achievements.comment: There is a blessing that applies weakness break to other enemies.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Heavenly Hand
achievements.description: Use a Technique to defeat all enemies upon entering battle
achievements.comment: Easiest to achieve with Serval in Simulated Universe 1.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Always Come Prepared
achievements.description: A character has 5 or more buffs at the beginning of a turn
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve in Sim U.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Highway Star
achievements.description: Allies act for 100 times in a single battle
achievements.comment: Bring 1 healer and 1 DPS to Sim U and let them turtle their way against the final boss
achievements.reference: "Highway Star" is a pop culture reference that is primarily associated with the song of the same name by the British rock band Deep Purple. The "highway star" is often interpreted as a metaphorical representation of a charismatic and adventurous individual who is constantly on the move, seeking new experiences and living life to the fullest.

achievements.name: Extreme Survival
achievements.description: Win a battle with all four allies having HP percentages equal to or less than 5%
achievements.comment: Can be achieved by RNG with the Galactic Lotto Curio in Sim U
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Bullet Time
achievements.description: Allies have 10 turns of action unbroken by enemies
achievements.comment: Easier to achieve in Simulated Universe with the Path of Remembrance (freeze enemies perpetually) or Path of Hunt.
achievements.reference: "Bullet Time" is a pop culture reference that originated from the 1999 film "The Matrix". It refers to a visual effect technique used in the movie to portray action sequences in a slowed-down, almost frozen state while the camera appears to move around the scene.

achievements.name: Perish Song
achievements.description: Get knocked out together with the enemy
achievements.comment: There are Automaton Spiders in Jarilo-IV Robot Settlement and Alchemists in Artisanship Commission (southwest) that can explode. The Spiders take 1 turn to charge before blowing themselves up. The Alchemists will kamikaze one of your unit when killed. Time it so that you also get KO'd by the explosion.
achievements.reference: A Pokémon move, Perish Song causes both the user and the opponent Pokémon to faint after three turns, regardless of their remaining health.

achievements.name: Bring a Gun to a Knife Fight
achievements.description: Deal 20000 DMG or higher to an enemy whose HP percentage is equal to or lower than 1% in a single action
achievements.comment: Good luck with timing this.
achievements.reference: The original phrase "Bring a gun to a knife fight" is often used metaphorically to describe the act of using excessive force or having overwhelming advantage in a situation where a lesser response would have sufficed.

achievements.name: Deus Ex Machina
achievements.description: Inflict Weakness Break on enemies 3 time(s) using the Trailblazer (Destruction) in a single battle
achievements.comment: Enemy is "broken" when their toughness meter hits zero.
achievements.reference: "Deus ex machina" is a literary and dramatic term that originated from ancient Greek theater. It translates to "god from the machine" in Latin. In ancient theater, it referred to a theatrical device where a god or divine being would descend onto the stage using a mechanical contraption (the machine) to resolve a seemingly unsolvable plot or conflict. In this context, the Trailblazer's metal baseball bat is employed as part of an unexpected intervention or solution to a problem like kicking Cocolia's ass.

achievements.name: Four-and-a-Half Pirouettes
achievements.description: Trigger Herta's talent with an ally's single action, and have her twirl 5 time(s)
achievements.comment: Easiest to achieve in Silvermane Restricted Guard Zone Difficulty 1, Winter Soldier's March. 5 relatively weak enemies on that stage. Alternatively you can try this in Forgotten Hall 1.
achievements.reference: A "pirouette" is a ballet term that describes a complete turn or spin on one leg. The "four-and-a-half" aspect suggest Herta spinning four and a half times.

achievements.name: Surge of Tiles
achievements.description: Qingque starts her turn in the "Hidden Hand" state for 3 turn(s) in a row
achievements.comment: Requires RNG but also a fast team for better results. There is an extensive guide on this pinned in the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: It's My Turn
achievements.description: Seele acts 5 time(s) in a row before the next ally unit's turn
achievements.comment: You can borrow a friend's Seele.
achievements.reference: "It's My Turn" is a phrase commonly used to assert one's right or opportunity to take action or to claim a turn in a particular situation. "It's always my turn" - Seele.

achievements.name: The Thirteen Labors
achievements.description: In a single battle, make Svarog block attacks toward Clara 13 times
achievements.comment: It might be exactly 13 times on the dot. Achievement name changed from Trial of Thirteen.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Coffee Lover
achievements.description: A cup of coffee thrice a day, keeps the foggy head at bay※ In a single battle, use Himeko's Ultimate 3 times
achievements.comment: You can borrow a friend's Himeko. 6 battles in a row in Calyx is considered a single battle.
achievements.reference: "Coffee" is some sort of mud water drank by people around the world for it's flavor, caffeine, and to flex their brand association. "I ordered a Starbucks today and they spelt my name wrong!"

achievements.name: Over-Protective
achievements.description: Win 1 battle(s) without having Gepard's Shields take any DMG
achievements.comment: You can borrow a friend's Gepard for this.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: When the National Anthem Rings
achievements.description: Have ally Bronya use "The Belobog March" 1 time(s) when fighting the bosses Gepard, Cocolia, and Bronya respectively
achievements.comment: Unfortunately you need to own Bronya to get this achievement.
achievements.reference: National anthems are ceremonial songs that represent a country or a nation and are often played on significant occasions, such as sporting events, national holidays, or when Bronya sees that Seele is about to use her ultimate.

achievements.name: Foolish Little Brother...
achievements.description: Use Serval to deal the final blow in a victory against boss Gepard
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 3 and Forgotten Hall 15.
achievements.reference: "Foolish Little Brother" is a phrase that suggests a condescending or dismissive attitude towards a younger sibling or someone who is perceived as naive, inexperienced, or lacking in wisdom. Canonically, Gepard is the little brother of Serval.

achievements.name: Serval's Parting Gift
achievements.description: Use Serval to deal the final blow in a victory against boss Cocolia
achievements.comment: Can be done in Sim U 6, during your first encounter with Cocolia in story, or in Forgotten Hall 15. NOT possible in Echo of War.
achievements.reference: Spoilers warning... Serval was Cocolia's best friend as they shared a passion for rock music. The fact that Serval has to deal the final blow against the human version of Cocolia (and not the transformed version) depicts a personal and heartfelt conclusion to their relationship.

achievements.name: Et tu, Bronya?
achievements.description: Use Bronya to deal the final blow in a victory against boss Cocolia
achievements.comment: Must be done in Sim U 6. You have a fraction of a second to reset the game and retry the battle if some other unit defeats Cocolia. Unfortunately you need to own Bronya to get this achievement.
achievements.reference:
"Et tu, Bronya?" is a phrase that alludes to the famous line "Et tu, Brute?" from William Shakespeare's play Julius Caesar. In the original line, Julius Caesar utters these words in disbelief and disappointment upon realizing that his trusted friend Brutus is also involved in the plot to assassinate him.
By adapting the phrase, it suggests a similar sentiment of betrayal or shock directed towards Bronya by her mother.

achievements.name: Listen...
achievements.description: Use the Trailblazer to fight boss Kafka and become Dominated by her
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 5.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: "I Don't Get No Respect!"
achievements.description: Enrage the Guardian Shadow with 4 character(s) in your team
achievements.comment: Can be found in Corridor of Fading Echoes (Jarilo-VI), Shape of Fulmination (Stagnant Shadow), Forgotten Hall and Everwinter Hill. Just attack her with basic/skill for each character when the message says "not to use basic/skill".
achievements.reference: "I don't get no respect!" is a pop culture reference associated with Rodney Dangerfield's comedic style and has become a recognizable phrase used to express feelings of being undervalued or underappreciated in various contexts.

achievements.name: Chad Norris
achievements.description: Defeat the Guardian Shadow without enraging it
achievements.comment: Can be found in Corridor of Fading Echoes (Jarilo-VI), Shape of Fulmination (Stagnant Shadow), Forgotten Hall and Everwinter Hill
achievements.reference: There is no such thing as evolution. Just a list of creatures Chuck Norris has allowed to live.

achievements.name: Attack! No Matter the Cost!
achievements.description: Trigger Silvermane Lieutenant's Shield Reflect at least 4 time(s) and defeat it
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 3 and Winter Soldier's March 1.
achievements.reference: The phrase is often associated with battle, military strategy, or situations requiring decisive action. It implies a disregard for personal safety or potential losses in the pursuit of victory or achieving a desired outcome. In this context, attacking the Silvermane Lieutenant when his shield is up is a very bad idea because it triggers his counter attack. It takes madness (or a chive hunter) to do it 4 times in a battle.

achievements.name: Decapitation Strike
achievements.description: Defeat the Silvermane Lieutenant without defeating any Silvermane Guards
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 3 and Winter Soldier's March 1.
achievements.reference: "Decapitation strike" is a military term that refers to a preemptive attack aimed at eliminating the leadership or high-ranking officials of an enemy or opposing force. The goal of a decapitation strike is to disrupt the command and control structure, create chaos, and diminish the enemy's ability to effectively coordinate their forces.

achievements.name: The Limping Lupine
achievements.description: Defeat Automaton Direwolf without triggering Felling Order
achievements.comment: Can be found in Great Mine (Jarilo-VI), Shape of Spike (Stagnant Shadow).
achievements.reference: "Felling Order" is a 10-hit nuke that'll rip any ally to pieces. Defeating this robot wolf without triggering their nuke is considered an achievement.

achievements.name: Regurgitation
achievements.description: Cause Frigid Prowler to fail to use Devour Otherling
achievements.comment: Can be found in Corridor of Fading Echoes (Jarilo-VI), Shape of Rime (Stagnant Shadow).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Hit It Where It Hurts Most
achievements.description: Defeat the Antimatter Engine without defeating either of the Doomsday Beast's hands in Echo of War
achievements.comment: Can be fought in Echo of War. Can be done on the easiest difficulty.
achievements.reference: "Hit it where it hurts most" is a phrase that suggests targeting the weakest or most vulnerable point or aspect of something or someone in order to maximize impact or effectiveness.

achievements.name: Cataclysm Disruptor
achievements.description: Prevent the Doomsday Beast from using Impending Doom in Echo of War
achievements.comment: Break/Freeze/Kill it, easier in Difficulty 1, attempt this stage for free after you've done your weekly 3 clears.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: "Thank You for Your Service"
achievements.description: Defeat Bronya without defeating the Silvermane Guards
achievements.comment: Can be found in Forgotten Hall 4 and 14.
achievements.reference: The phrase "Thank you for your service" is often used to express gratitude and appreciation to individuals who have served in the military, law enforcement, emergency services, or other professions that involve serving and protecting the community or country. By defeating Bronya without defeating any of her guards, you're thanking them by not kicking their asses.

achievements.name: Achilles' Horse
achievements.description: Defeat Voidranger: Trampler when it's aiming at an ally
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 5.
achievements.reference: The term "Achilles' Horse" is a play on words, referring to Achilles, a prominent Greek hero of the Trojan War, and his "Achilles' heel" which refers to a vulnerability or weak point in an otherwise strong or invulnerable person.

achievements.name: Doldrums
achievements.description: Make Stormbringer fail to use Windfall Storm due to having no ally with Wind Shear
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 2 and Stagnant Shadow for wind ascension materials. Natasha and March 7 can cleanse wind shear.
achievements.reference: Originally, the term "doldrums" referred specifically to a region near the equator known for its calm, windless seas, which caused delays and frustration for sailors. This literal meaning has extended metaphorically to describe a state of feeling stuck or in a lull, much like a Strormbringer failing to use their wind attack due to a lack of wind.

achievements.name: Code of Chivalry
achievements.description: Defeat Gepard without defeating the Silvermane Guards that were summoned
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 3.
achievements.reference: The Code of Chivalry is a medieval code of conduct that governed the behavior and ideals of knights during the Middle Ages. It emphasized virtues such as honor, courage, loyalty, courtesy, and justice. So it's considered just to defeat Gepard without defeating his allies.

achievements.name: Full Metal Jacket
achievements.description: Stay alive after being hit by the Auxiliary Robot Arm Unit's Controlled Blasting ability
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 4.
achievements.reference: "Full Metal Jacket" is a 1987 war film directed by Stanley Kubrick. The title is derived from the term "full metal jacket," which refers to a type of bullet with a soft lead core surrounded by a harder metal shell. The concept  represents the hardened exterior or protective shell that soldiers often develop in the face of war and the dehumanizing effects of combat.

achievements.name: Right-Hand Man's Many Right-Handed Right Hands
achievements.description: Defeat Svarog after destroying 4 Auxiliary Robot Arm Unit(s)
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 4.
achievements.reference: "Right-Hand Man's Many Right-Handed Right Hands" uses wordplay and repetition for emphasis and effect. In a literal sense, the phrase describes Svarog possessing multiple robotic devices serving as his right-hand man.

achievements.name: Homemade Crushed Ice
achievements.description: Defeat the Ice Edge summoned by Cocolia 4 time(s)
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 6.
achievements.reference: Crushed ice has a unique texture and provides a refreshing and cooling effect in drinks and desserts. Bingsu or Shaved Ice are popular cold desserts eaten all over the world.

achievements.name: Road to Canossa
achievements.description: Interrupt Cocolia's use of "Wrath of Winterland Saints" when she is charging
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 6. (NOT Echo of War). Either Break her or Freeze her.
achievements.reference: "The Road to Canossa" event was like a major power showdown back in the medieval days. The Holy Roman Emperor and the Pope were battling it out for control. So, the Emperor, Henry IV, had to suck it up and make a journey to Canossa to meet with Pope Gregory VII. Picture this: Henry IV had to wait outside the castle gates in freezing weather for three whole days, dressed all humbly and stuff. It was like a massive show of submission and repentance to the Pope's authority. Finally, the Pope forgave him and lifted the excommunication. This whole event was a major deal, showing how the Pope had serious power over rulers and how they had to bow down to the Church. It was a real turning point in the whole church-versus-state power struggle back in the day.

achievements.name: Save the Princess
achievements.description: Defeat Cocolia without defeating Bronya
achievements.comment: Must be in Sim U 6.
achievements.reference: "Save the Princess" is a common trope in various forms of storytelling, particularly in video games and fairy tales. It typically involves a heroic character embarking on a quest to rescue a princess who has been captured, imprisoned, or in some kind of danger. The trope has been criticized for perpetuating gender stereotypes and portraying women as helpless damsels in distress - which is why in Star Rail, both the Queen and the Princess are on the field ready to tag-team your ass.

achievements.name: Hot-Blooded
achievements.description: Defeat Cocolia, Mother of Deception, without any ally being Frozen at any point of the battle in Echo of War
achievements.comment: Must be in Echo of War. Use the item that prevents freezing by 50%. Fight her on Difficulty 1 for free after you've done your weekly 3 clears.
achievements.reference: "Hot-Blooded" is an idiomatic expression that typically refers to someone who is passionate, impulsive, or full of intense emotions. It suggests a person who possesses a fiery temperament - to such an extent that they can't be frozen.

achievements.name: Accidental Amnesia
achievements.description: Clear Decaying Shadow's Gauge Recollection and cause its ability, Liberation of the Golden Age, to fail
achievements.comment: Can be found in Backwater Pass (Jarilo-VI), Shape of Mirage (Stagnant Shadow)
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Friendly Fire
achievements.description: Defeat the Aurumaton Gatekeeper with the Entranced Ingenium: Illumination Dragonfish's "Candle Flame"
achievements.comment: Can be found in the Cavern of Corrosion - Path of Conflagration; and there are two top right of Artisanship Commission. The Candle Flame are thoses fishes he spawn that deal AOE damage when killed.
achievements.reference: "Friendly fire" is a term used to describe the accidental or unintended firing of weapons or other attacks on friendly or allied forces during military operations (E.g Russia's military operations).

achievements.name: Wrathful Aurumaton
achievements.description: In a single battle, cause Aurumaton Gatekeeper to enter the Wrath state 3 times
achievements.comment: Can be found in the Cavern of Corrosion - Path of Conflagration; and there are two top right of Artisanship Commission.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Will of Steel
achievements.description: In a single battle against Boss Kafka, dispel Dominated 3 times
achievements.comment: Can be found in Sim U 5. Natasha and March 7 can cleanse.
achievements.reference: When someone is said to have a "will of steel," it implies that they possess a remarkable level of determination, fortitude, and tenacity. Legend speaks of a small group of savants capable of enduring mommy Kafka.

achievements.name: This Fragile Body
achievements.description: Use Silver Wolf to apply different Type Weaknesses for a total of 3 time(s) to a single enemy in a single battle
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Silver Wolf
achievements.reference: The phrase "This Fragile Body" serves as a reminder of the inherent fragility and transience of our physical existence. It acknowledges that all is weak to Silver Wolf given a high enough Effect Hit %.

achievements.name: When the Hunter Becomes the Hunted
achievements.description: Use Silver Wolf to fight enemy Kafka and apply 2 Weaknesse(s) to her in a single battle
achievements.comment: You must own Silver Wolf for this achievement; Kafka can be found in Sim U 5
achievements.reference: The phrase suggests a shift in power, where the person who was once the aggressor or pursuer becomes the one being pursued. It can imply a sense of poetic justice or the consequences of one's actions coming back to haunt them. Apparently Silver Wolf knows Kafka's weakness.

achievements.name: Sickly Complexion
achievements.description: Dispel the Prana-Siphon state for a total of 5 times during a single battle against Phantylia
achievements.comment: So you need to dispel the enemy 5 times each time in 5 battles... for a total of 25 dispels

achievements.name: Horticulturalist
achievements.description: Defeat Phantylia without defeating any Abundance Lotuses
achievements.comment: You can refight Phantylia in the Echo of War. Choose the easiest difficulty.

achievements.name: BOOM
achievements.description: In a single battle, trigger 4 different DoT effects with 1 use of Kafka's Skill "Caressing Moonlight"
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Kafka for this

achievements.name: Unfulfilled Wish
achievements.description: "Unnecessary."※ In a single battle, use the character Blade to restore his HP from less than or equal to 5% to greater than or equal to 30% in one single action for 2 time(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Blade for this; both Ultimate and Follow up attacks work but he needs to be below 5% HP

achievements.name: Go, Bladie
achievements.description: Use ally Blade in combat against boss Kafka and be Dominated by her
achievements.comment: Requires owning Blade

achievements.name: Win by Decision
achievements.description: In a single battle, use Luka's "Sky-Shatter Fist" for a total of 4 time(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Luka for this

achievements.name: Self-Hypnosis
achievements.description: Use ally Kafka in combat against boss Kafka and be Dominated by her
achievements.comment: Requires owning Kafka

achievements.name: Mega Rich Light-Bending Guy
achievements.description: Obtain 100000000 credits in total
achievements.comment: Whale whale whale. This will take a very long time, unless you exchange a tremendous amount of Embers for Credits via the Store.
achievements.reference: "Mega Rich Light-Bending Guy" is probably referencing the character by the same name in the role playing game "Disco Elysium". He is a multi-billionaire, speculated to have net-worth in the triple digits.

achievements.name: The Express Passenger's Guide to the Galaxy
achievements.description: Obtain 10 characters
achievements.comment: As of the Yukong V1.1 update, you can obtain 10 characters for free without summoning.
achievements.reference: "The Express Passenger's Guide to the Galaxy" is a playful and creative twist on the title of the popular science fiction novel "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" by Douglas Adams. The original book follows the misadventures of an ordinary human named Arthur Dent as he is whisked away on a series of intergalactic journeys after the Earth is unexpectedly destroyed.

achievements.name: Express Crew Roster
achievements.description: Obtain 20 characters
achievements.comment: You can obtain up to 10 characters for free without summoning. As for the rest - you will have to pull.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Great Interastral Migration
achievements.description: Obtain 50 characters
achievements.comment: Not possible to achieve yet
achievements.reference: "The Great Interastral Migration" suggests a massive migration or movement of beings or entities across different star systems or galaxies. It name might have been influenced by the "Great Migration", which was one of the largest movements of people in United States history. In the context of Star Rail, you migrated 50 characters (and migrated away your money) from different worlds into your party.

achievements.name: Ripples on the Dirac Sea (I)
achievements.description: Obtain 10 type(s) of Light Cones
achievements.comment: You can easily obtain 10 different light cones for free without summoning.
achievements.reference: In quantum physics, the Dirac equation describes the behavior of particles such as electrons. The Dirac sea is a theoretical concept that represents a sea of negative energy states that are fully occupied by electrons, according to the Dirac equation. It might represent the emergence of new ideas, concepts, or discoveries within the realm of physics or science. It could also symbolize the impact of small actions or events that have far-reaching consequences, creating ripples or waves that reverberate through the interconnectedness of life and the universe.

achievements.name: Ripples on the Dirac Sea (II)
achievements.description: Obtain 20 type(s) of Light Cones
achievements.comment: You can obtain 20 different light cones for free without summoning, though this will take time.
achievements.reference: In quantum physics, the Dirac equation describes the behavior of particles such as electrons. The Dirac sea is a theoretical concept that represents a sea of negative energy states that are fully occupied by electrons, according to the Dirac equation. It might represent the emergence of new ideas, concepts, or discoveries within the realm of physics or science. It could also symbolize the impact of small actions or events that have far-reaching consequences, creating ripples or waves that reverberate through the interconnectedness of life and the universe.

achievements.name: Ripples on the Dirac Sea (III)
achievements.description: Obtain 40 type(s) of Light Cones
achievements.comment: You have to summon on the Light Cones banner in order to obtain this achievement.
achievements.reference: In quantum physics, the Dirac equation describes the behavior of particles such as electrons. The Dirac sea is a theoretical concept that represents a sea of negative energy states that are fully occupied by electrons, according to the Dirac equation. It might represent the emergence of new ideas, concepts, or discoveries within the realm of physics or science. It could also symbolize the impact of small actions or events that have far-reaching consequences, creating ripples or waves that reverberate through the interconnectedness of life and the universe.

achievements.name: Supreme Treasure of the Netherworld
achievements.description: Obtain a 5-star Relic
achievements.comment: 5-star relics can be crafted or farmed in Simulated Universe and Caverns of Corrosion.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Fate/stranger Fake
achievements.description: Obtain 5 5-star Relic(s) from the Omni-Synthesizer
achievements.comment: Crafting 5-star relics require 100 Relic Remains, which you obtain from events and salvaging existing 5-star Relics. It takes 10 5-star relics to obtain enough material to craft one 5-star relic.
achievements.reference: "Fate/stranger Fake" is the name of an actual japanese light novel series based on the popular "Fate/stay night" franchise. The plot centers around a fautily copied "Grail War".

achievements.name: Interastral Peace Diamond Membership
achievements.description: Obtain 1000000 credits in total
achievements.comment: You will naturally obtain 1 million credits from playing the game.
achievements.reference: The IPC (Interastral Peace Corp) is an entity that governs free trade, issues money and monopolizes resources. It shares some roles with the IMF (International Monetary Fund), an UN organization that deals with economic stability in the world.

achievements.name: Interastral Peace Supreme Diamond Membership
achievements.description: Obtain 10000000 credits in total
achievements.comment: You can exchange Embers for Credits in the store to expedite this process.
achievements.reference: The IPC (Interastral Peace Corp) is an entity that governs free trade, issues money and monopolizes resources. It shares some roles with the IMF (International Monetary Fund), an UN organization that deals with economic stability in the world.

achievements.name: Texting Enjoyer
achievements.description: Reply to 10 idle chat texts from other characters
achievements.comment: Characters you obtain from summoning can send you daily text messages. Each new daily text message count towards this achievement.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: That Friendship Has Sailed
achievements.description: Reply to 60 idle chat texts from other characters
achievements.comment: You can only get text messages from characters that you own. You CAN run out of new daily text messages. You need to own at least 22 units to receive 60+ text messages.
achievements.reference: "That Friendship Has Sailed" is a nautical metaphor that suggests a friendship or relationship has come to an end or irreversibly drifted apart. It will strike you emotionally when you realize that after receiving three daily text messages from characters, they may permanently stop sending you daily texts.

achievements.name: The First and Last Freedom
achievements.description: Enter battle with 4 allies with HP percentage equal to or less than 1% in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Can be achieved by RNG with the Galactic Lotto Curio in Sim U.
achievements.reference: "The First and Last Freedom" references a philosophical book written by Jiddu Krishnamurti and published in 1954. In this book, Krishnamurti explores the nature of freedom and liberation from various perspectives, including psychological, social, and spiritual aspects. In this context, there is certainly no better way to be liberated from life than to enter battle at 1 health.

achievements.name: The Art of Loving
achievements.description: Allies receive Shields 50 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Several Path of Preservation blessings give shields.
achievements.reference: "The Art of Loving" is a phrase that refers to a book written by Erich Fromm, a renowned social psychologist and philosopher, first published in 1956. In this influential work, Fromm explores the complexities and intricacies of love, presenting it as an art that requires understanding, effort, and skill, or in our case, giving a thicc shield to your allies.

achievements.name: Freeze!
achievements.description: Keep a single enemy Frozen for 10 turns in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Take the Path of Remembrance and pick Freeze blessings.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Elemental Reaction System
achievements.description: Deal 5 or more Types of DMG in a single action in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Take the Path of Nihility or Elation, and use Path Resonance. Also blessings that give "Aftertaste" effect can help.
achievements.reference: In the popular action role-playing game Genshin Impact, the Elemental Reaction System is a fundamental gameplay mechanic that governs the interactions between different elemental abilities possessed by the game's characters. (E.g Overload, Superconduct, Frozen, Vaporize and Melt).

achievements.name: Your Opponent Has Poor Connection
achievements.description: Allies take consecutive actions 20 time(s) in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Mix of freeze / slow / and speed blessings
achievements.reference: "Your Opponent has Poor Connection" is a phrase commonly used in online multiplayer gaming when there are issues with the network connection of another player. It typically implies that there may be lag, delays, or interruptions in their gameplay, allowing others to take advantage of their situation.

achievements.name: Twenty Four Love Poems and a Song of Despair
achievements.description: All allies have HP percentages equal to or less than 5% when winning a battle in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Can be achieved by RNG with the Galactic Lotto Curio in Sim U.
achievements.reference: "Twenty Four Love Poems and a Song of Despair" is the title of a poetry collection written by the renowned Chilean poet Pablo Neruda. Published in 1924, the collection explores themes of love, desire, and longing, interwoven with a sense of melancholy and despair. The collection has resonated with readers around the world, captivating them with its exploration of love's joys, struggles, and transformative power, emotions Star Rail players feel when they pull a 5* early and it's Himeko.

achievements.name: We Call the Heart Dancing in the Dark the Moon
achievements.description: Have at least 3 enemy unit(s) be afflicted with Shock, Burn, Bleed, and Wind Shear simultaneously in the Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Take the Path of Nihility and use Path Resonance.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Good Night, My Friend
achievements.description: Defeat 15 enemies in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Ready Player One
achievements.description: Defeat 1000 enemies in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "Ready Player One" is a scifi novel written by Ernest Cline, published in 2011. The story is set in a dystopian future where people escape the harsh realities of the real world by immersing themselves in a virtual reality world called the OASIS (much like a Simulated Universe).

achievements.name: Consumerism Psychology
achievements.description: Obtain 500 Cosmic Fragment(s)
achievements.comment: Cosmic fragments are currency you obtain in Simulated Universe, used solely inside SimU to purchase or upgrade Blessings, Curios, and for transactional events.
achievements.reference: Consumerism psychology is something you might study in school, that aims to provide insights into consumer behavior to help marketers, businesses, policymakers, and individuals better understand the psychological mechanisms behind consumption choices.

achievements.name: The Great Cosmic Gatsby
achievements.description: Obtain 20000 Cosmic Fragment(s)
achievements.comment: Cosmic fragments are currency you obtain in Simulated Universe, used solely inside SimU to purchase or upgrade Blessings, Curios, and for transactional events.
achievements.reference: "The Great Gatsby" is a classic novel that explores the American Dream, social class, and the pursuit of wealth and success in the 1920s. It delves into the life of Jay Gatsby, a wealthy and enigmatic figure, and examines the themes of love, illusion, and the corruption of the American Dream.

achievements.name: A Special Experience
achievements.description: Encounter 10 Special Event(s) in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: A Not-So-Special Experience
achievements.description: Encounter 100 Special Event(s) in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: A Room of One's Own
achievements.description: Complete exploring Simulated Universe: World 1
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "A Room of One's Own" is a phrase that references a seminal feminist essay written by Virginia Woolf and published in 1929. The essay explores the topic of women's independence and creative freedom, emphasizing the importance of women having a physical and metaphorical space to call their own. Many kids in highschool and some in university will have had to read "A Room of One's Own" in their curriculum.

achievements.name: Penrose Stairs
achievements.description: Complete exploring Simulated Universe at difficulty level 2 or higher
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Penrose Stairs, also known as the Penrose Triangle or the Impossible Staircase, is a visual illusion and geometric concept that was first introduced by the mathematician and physicist Roger Penrose in the 1950s. It involves a two-dimensional depiction of a staircase that appears to form a continuous loop, creating the optical illusion of an impossible or never-ending structure. The Penrose Stairs challenge our perception of space and depth, as it seems to defy logic, just like how Welt's black hole hits for peanut damage.

achievements.name: King of Infinity
achievements.description: Complete exploring Simulated Universe at difficulty level 4 or higher
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Fevered Strike
achievements.description: Break 20 destructible object(s) in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Rosebud
achievements.description: Break 400 destructible object(s) in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "Rosebud" is a famous and enigmatic reference that originates from the 1941 film "Citizen Kane," directed by Orson Welles. In the film, "Rosebud" is the dying words of the protagonist, Charles Foster Kane, a wealthy newspaper tycoon. The meaning behind the word becomes a central mystery of the story. It is often used as a metaphor for the elusive nature of happiness, the longing for lost innocence, or the quest for meaning in one's life. I guess when you start breaking 400 destructibles in SimU, even the game has to wonder what you're doing with your life?

achievements.name: Adrenaline
achievements.description: Actively Enhance Blessings 10 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Only enhancement from spending cosmic fragments with Herta counts as "actively enhancing" blessings.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Infectious Good Luck
achievements.description: Actively Enhance Blessings 200 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Only enhancement from spending cosmic fragments with Herta counts as "actively enhancing" blessings.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Do Android Snails Dream of Electric Trees?
achievements.description: Activate abilities in the Ability Tree 2 times
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: References the popular dystopian scifi novel "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?"

achievements.name: Expert Tree-Climber
achievements.description: Activate abilities in the Ability Tree 26 times
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: My Swiss Army Curios
achievements.description: Unlock 3 Curios in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "My Swiss Army Curios" is a phrase that combines the concept of a Swiss Army Knife with a collection of curiosities or intriguing objects. It suggests a diverse assortment of unique, multifunctional items that are versatile, practical, and perhaps even a bit quirky.

achievements.name: Life Is but a Game
achievements.description: Unlock 40 Curios in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Who Moved My Pokeball?
achievements.description: Capture Trotters 1 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Defeat a Trotter one time in SimU.
achievements.reference: "Who Moved My Pokeball?" references the popular franchise Pokémon, specifically the concept of the Pokeball, which is used to capture and contain Pokémon. The phrase playfully suggests a situation where someone's Pokeball, a symbol of control and ownership over Pokémon, has been moved or tampered with without their knowledge or consent.

achievements.name: A Porcine Football Team
achievements.description: Capture Trotters 66 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Good luck! Trotters are less likely to escape when cc'd. You can encounter 3 of them in Occurence.
achievements.reference: "A Porcine Football Team" refers to a football (soccer) team comprised of pigs. This phrase combines the world of sports with the unique characteristics of pigs, creating a playful and imaginative concept.

achievements.name: Don't Let It Get Away!
achievements.description: Let Trotters escape 1 times in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Existence Precedes Essence
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Preservation in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Preservation Blessings appearing by picking the path of Preservation upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: "Existence precedes essence" is a phrase associated with existentialism, particularly the ideas of Jean-Paul Sartre, a prominent existentialist philosopher. It means that before we have a set purpose or meaning in life, we first exist as individuals. It's like a blank canvas that we get to paint on with our choices and actions. We have the freedom to decide who we want to be and what we want to do with our lives. We're not stuck with a predetermined path or set of rules, except when we need to choose 12 blessings of the preservation path.

achievements.name: Memories Look at Me
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Remembrance in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Remembrance Blessings appearing by picking the path of Remembrance upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Create A Beautiful Chaos
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Elation in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Elation Blessings appearing by picking the path of Elation upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Velocity of the Universe's Expansion
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of The Hunt in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Hunt Blessings appearing by picking the path of Hunt upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Wreck-It Self
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Destruction in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Destruction Blessings appearing by picking the path of Destruction upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Referencing Disney's animated movie Wreck-It Ralph, where the titular character is known for destroying things.

achievements.name: Gnosticism
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Nihility in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Nihility Blessings appearing by picking the path of Nihility upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Exhalation
achievements.description: Unlock 12 Blessing(s) of Abundance in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Abundance Blessings appearing by picking the path of Abundance upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Millennium Bug in Amber
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Preservation when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Preservation Blessings appearing by picking the path of Preservation upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: You See Memories
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Remembrance when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Remembrance Blessings appearing by picking the path of Remembrance upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Don't Worry Be Happy
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Elation when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Elation Blessings appearing by picking the path of Elation upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: One of Bobby McFerrin's best song - spreading happiness and "elation" all around. It encourages listeners to let go of their worries and find happiness in the present moment. The song became a commercial success and won several awards, including Song of the Year and Record of the Year.

achievements.name: The Speed of Thought
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of The Hunt when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Hunt Blessings appearing by picking the path of Hunt upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Cool Guys Don't Look At Explosions
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Destruction when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Destruction Blessings appearing by picking the path of Destruction upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference:
"Cool Guys Don't Look at Explosions" is a phrase that originates from a comedic song by The Lonely Island, a comedy music group. The phrase has since become a popular meme and cultural reference.
The phrase suggests that individuals who are perceived as cool or composed do not show any outward reaction or concern when explosive or dramatic events occur.

achievements.name: The Plague of Fantasies
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Nihility when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Nihility Blessings appearing by picking the path of Nihility upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: "The Plague of Fantasies" is a phrase that refers to a concept explored by the psychoanalyst and philosopher Slavoj Žižek in his book of the same name. In this work, Žižek delves into the notion that fantasies—specifically, the fantasies that shape our desires, beliefs, and perceptions—can have a pervasive and problematic influence on our lives.

achievements.name: Angel's Breath
achievements.description: Have 10 or more Blessing(s) of Abundance when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can increase your chances of Abundance Blessings appearing by picking the path of Abundance upon entering SimU.
achievements.reference: "Angel's Breath" is a poetic and metaphorical phrase that evokes a sense of delicacy, purity, and ethereal beauty. It conjures an image of something incredibly gentle and soothing, like the soft whisper of a breeze or your entire team getting healed and cleansed.

achievements.name: A Finger in Every Pie
achievements.description: Have Blessings from 6 or more Paths when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: There are 7 different paths, and you only need to pick 1 blessing from each path to satisfy this achievement.
achievements.reference: "A Finger in Every Pie" is an idiom that means being involved or having an interest in multiple activities, projects, or areas of influence. It suggests a person who likes to be engaged in various endeavors and has a tendency to participate in different aspects of life.

achievements.name: An Island Unto Oneself
achievements.description: Have 6 or less Blessing(s) when clearing Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher
achievements.comment: Path upgrade counts as 1 blessing FYI, so it's really 5 blessings + path upgrade. You are guaranteed to get 5 blessings in a run, so try to avoid combat as much as possible. You can also choose to avoid getting the path upgrade. In combat stages, you need to avoid every mob except the very last one guarding the portal. There is an extensive guide on this in the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: The phrase implies a sense of self-containment, where an individual is self-sustaining and does not rely heavily on others for companionship or support. It suggests a person who is comfortable being alone and finds fulfillment and satisfaction within themselves.

achievements.name: Private Collector
achievements.description: Have 22 or more Blessing(s) when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Triangle Strategy
achievements.description: Flip cards 3 times in a single Nildis event in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: This requires RNG but with enough Sim U attempts, you're sure to get it.
achievements.reference:
Triangle Strategy is a tactical RPG by Square Enix and Artdink with turn-based combat on a grid.
When you encounter the Nildis event, the dealer says "There is a certain chance that you will unfold the most wonderful memory of the world... However, you might also reveal some mysterious affairs that aren't supposed to be made known." 
In Triangle Strategy, you get to choose one of three paths and your choice will affect the game as a whole, kind of like flipping a card.

achievements.name: Master Ball
achievements.description: Have 8 or more Curio(s) when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Big Galatic Lotto will help with this, though RNG.
achievements.reference: The "Master Ball" is a pop culture reference from the Pokémon franchise. In Pokémon games, the Master Ball is a highly coveted and extremely powerful Poké Ball that has a 100% capture rate, meaning it can catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

achievements.name: A 4-Star Rarity Daydream
achievements.description: Have 0 or less Cosmic Fragment(s) when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You must have exactly 0 fragments going into the final boss battle
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: It's Good to Be Rich!
achievements.description: Have 1024 or more Cosmic Fragment(s) when clearing Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You can achieve this by stockpiling your cosmic fragment and not spending any during a run.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: On Fire off the Shoulder of Orion
achievements.description: Lose against Elite enemies in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: There are two elite enemies in every Sim U (Outside of World 1).
achievements.reference: "On Fire off the Shoulder of Orion" is a phrase that references a line from the science fiction film Blade Runner. In the movie, the character Roy Batty delivers a monologue in which he says, "I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion." It implies witnessing something remarkable, unusual, or breathtaking that goes beyond ordinary human experiences, like getting schooled by elite enemies in Sim U.

achievements.name: Glitter at the Tannhauser Gate
achievements.description: Lose against the Boss Enemies in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: Lose against the final enemy in a SimU run.
achievements.reference: "Glitter at the Tannhauser Gate" is yet another phrase from Blade Runner. When someone says, "Glitter at the Tannhauser Gate," they are drawing upon the imagery and impact of that line from Blade Runner to describe a breathtaking or captivating experience, just like seeing your team wiped out and you missing out on the boss drops in Sim U.

achievements.name: Wake Up!
achievements.description: Lose the battle in the Nildis event in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You'll find this event randomly in Region - Occurence.
achievements.reference: Pretty sure it's another Blade Runner reference, which can be seen as a rallying cry for the replicants, urging them to recognize their own humanity and to rebel against the system that seeks to control and oppress them. It symbolizes their desire for autonomy, self-realization, and the pursuit of a meaningful existence.

achievements.name: Lost Like Tears in Rain
achievements.description: Lose the battle in the tavern event in Simulated Universe
achievements.comment: You'll find this event randomly in Region - Encounter.
achievements.reference: Another Blade Runner reference. When someone says, "Lost Like Tears in Rain," they are drawing upon the poignant imagery and sentiment of that line from Blade Runner to evoke a sense of the transient and fragile nature of existence. It reminds us of the impermanence of our moments, memories, and emotions.

achievements.name: Console Game
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher without using the Downloader
achievements.comment: The downloader is an interactable NPC in SimU that lets you add another ally to your team.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: If I Can Stop One Heart From Breaking
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher without breaking any destructible objects
achievements.comment: Avoid the urge to destroy any destructible: Barrels, healing and technique containers.
achievements.reference: "If I Can Stop One Heart from Breaking" is the title of a poem written by Emily Dickinson, one of the most renowned American poets. The poem reflects Dickinson's introspective and compassionate nature, contemplating the impact of even the smallest acts of kindness and empathy.

achievements.name: The Grand Budapest Hotel
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher and use Techniques 25 times
achievements.comment: Reset to begin with the Curio that summons more destructible objects on the map - it gives double technique points when breaking the purple structures.
achievements.reference: "The Grand Budapest Hotel" is a pop culture reference to a 2014 comedy film directed by Wes Anderson. The film tells the story of a legendary concierge named Gustave H. and his apprentice, Zero Moustafa, who become embroiled in a series of adventures surrounding a stolen painting and a valuable family fortune. Gustave is legendary due to his exceptional dedication, impeccable service, and charismatic personality. Perhaps he knew more than 25 techniques at any one time.

achievements.name: Aleph Is the Universe
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher with only 1 character in the team
achievements.comment: So you can bring a team of four and bulldoze your way to the final boss. In the room before the final boss, change your team so that you only have one unit. If you beat the final boss, you'll still get this achievement. There are text and video guides for this achievement in the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: "Aleph is the Universe" is a phrase that refers to a concept originating from the writings of Argentine author Jorge Luis Borges. In Borges' short story "The Aleph," the Aleph is described as a point in space that contains all other points, allowing one to see the entire universe from that single location. In this context, a single character is that point, being able to finish the entire Simulated Universe.

achievements.name: Coherence
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe at difficulty 2 or higher with 4 characters of the same Path
achievements.comment: You just need to have 4 characters of the same path on the final boss fight, so you can use other characters leading up to it.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Does This Game Not Have a Platinum Trophy?
achievements.description: Clear Simulated Universe (Difficulty Level 2 and above) with all allies at full HP at the end of every battle
achievements.comment: Helps to have a Bailu, Luocha, or Gepard and a mix of shield/heal blessings.
achievements.reference: In the context of PlayStation games, a Platinum Trophy is an achievement or trophy that is awarded to players when they have earned all other trophies in the game. In Star Rail, it is considered a great achievement to complete SimU at full HP every battle.

achievements.name: Shadows Die Ad Infinitum (I)
achievements.description: Defeat Stagnant Shadow 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 3000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Shadows Die Ad Infinitum" is a phrase that combines imagery and Latin words to create a dramatic and evocative expression. It suggests the idea of eternal or infinite death for shadows, such as having to farm them 800 times for an achievement.

achievements.name: Shadows Die Ad Infinitum (II)
achievements.description: Defeat Stagnant Shadow 400 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 12000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Shadows Die Ad Infinitum" is a phrase that combines imagery and Latin words to create a dramatic and evocative expression. It suggests the idea of eternal or infinite death for shadows, such as having to farm them 800 times for an achievement.

achievements.name: Shadows Die Ad Infinitum (III)
achievements.description: Defeat Stagnant Shadow 800 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 24000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Shadows Die Ad Infinitum" is a phrase that combines imagery and Latin words to create a dramatic and evocative expression. It suggests the idea of eternal or infinite death for shadows, such as having to farm them 800 times for an achievement.

achievements.name: Day of the Triffids (I)
achievements.description: Defeat Calyx 100 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 1000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Day of the Triffids" is a scifi novel written by John Wyndham and published in 1951. The novel tells the story of a catastrophic event where the majority of the world's population is blinded by unusual celestial phenomena. During this chaos, genetically modified plants known as "triffids" - large, mobile, and venomous plants - begin to pose a threat to humanity's survival. Calyxes appear in the shape of a triffid

achievements.name: Day of the Triffids (II)
achievements.description: Defeat Calyx 500 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 5000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Day of the Triffids" is a scifi novel written by John Wyndham and published in 1951. The novel tells the story of a catastrophic event where the majority of the world's population is blinded by unusual celestial phenomena. During this chaos, genetically modified plants known as "triffids" - large, mobile, and venomous plants - begin to pose a threat to humanity's survival. Calyxes appear in the shape of a triffid

achievements.name: Day of the Triffids (III)
achievements.description: Defeat Calyx 1000 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost 10000 stamina.
achievements.reference: "Day of the Triffids" is a scifi novel written by John Wyndham and published in 1951. The novel tells the story of a catastrophic event where the majority of the world's population is blinded by unusual celestial phenomena. During this chaos, genetically modified plants known as "triffids" - large, mobile, and venomous plants - begin to pose a threat to humanity's survival. Calyxes appear in the shape of a triffid

achievements.comment: This will cost 4000 stamina.
