achievements.name: Phantom of the Cavern (III)
achievements.description: Complete Caverns of Corrosion 800 time(s)
achievements.comment: This will cost a mind-boggling 32000 stamina.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Echo of War (I)
achievements.description: Complete Echo of War 1 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Echo of War (II)
achievements.description: Complete Echo of War 10 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Voyage to the Ends of the Sky
achievements.description: Clear Forgotten Hall: Memory of Xianzhou Stage 6
achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: Earth Week
achievements.description: Log in 7 days in a row
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Earth Week is a dedicated period of time to focus on environmental awareness and action, providing an opportunity to come together as a global community to protect and preserve our planet, including fictional planets.

achievements.name: Earth Month
achievements.description: Log in for a total of 30 days
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Earth Year
achievements.description: Log in for a total of 365 days
achievements.comment: Congrats! You've logged in for a year.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Diogenes' Utopia
achievements.description: See what Belobog is famous for!※ You've obtained every useful prop in the trash cans!
achievements.comment: Investigate all 10 trash cans in the Administrative District.
achievements.reference: Diogenes' Utopia is a concept that draws inspiration from the ancient Greek philosopher Diogenes of Sinope, who lived in the 4th century BCE. People would embrace a minimalist lifestyle, living with only the bare essentials and rejecting excess and luxury. It's trash can, not trash can't.

achievements.name: Insatiable
achievements.description: Sometimes, there can be too much of a good thing...※ Use Vomit Inducing Agent 1 time(s)
achievements.comment: Use the Vomit Inducing Agent consumable. You can get this recipe from talking to Maxime in Boulder Town, near Natasha's clinic.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Trashy Humor
achievements.description: One man's trash is another man's treasure※ Use Trash to synthesize Consumables 10 times
achievements.comment: Synthesize 10 Trash consumables. Trash can be found by breaking destructable objects in Jarilo-VI.
achievements.reference: Trashy humor is a style of humor that relies on lowbrow, crude, or vulgar content to elicit laughter. It often involves jokes or comedic situations that may be considered offensive, tasteless, or inappropriate by some individuals. In this context, Star Rail allows players to synthesize literal Trash as a consumable.

achievements.name: Karmic Wheel
achievements.description: Let the Higher Existence that lives within our hearts sigh at you※ Find a way to use up your Praise of High Morals
achievements.comment: Submit one Praise of High Morals during hidden events, including at the Fountain in the Administrative District.
achievements.reference: The Karmic Wheel is a concept rooted in various religious and spiritual traditions, such as Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. It represents the belief in a cycle of cause and effect, where the consequences of one's actions determine their future experiences and circumstances.

achievements.name: Saint
achievements.description: Let the Higher Existence that lives within our hearts give you a thumbs-up※ Obtain Praise of High Morals 20 time(s)
achievements.comment: Collect 20 Praises of High Morals.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: It Takes Three
achievements.description: Win a battle with a team that has 3 characters of the same Path
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Versatile Joker
achievements.description: Use a total of 20 character(s) to form a team with Sampo and win at least 1 battle
achievements.comment: You can borrow a variety of units from friends for this achievement.
achievements.reference: In the context of a person, a Versatile Joker may possess a diverse skill set, allowing them to excel in different areas or take on various roles as needed. They may be adept at humor, wit, or entertaining others, possessing the ability to make people laugh or brighten their mood. Additionally, they may have a talent for adapting to different social environments and interacting with people from different backgrounds. AKA Sampo.

achievements.name: Match-Three
achievements.description: Win a battle with a team that has 3 characters of the same Type
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Match-three games are a popular genre in video gaming, particularly in mobile gaming. These games require players to swap adjacent game pieces to form rows or columns of at least three of the same kind. The genre was popularized by games like Bejeweled and Candy Crush Saga, which became massive hits and influenced numerous other games in the genre.

achievements.name: One Big Happy Family
achievements.description: Win 1 battle(s) with a team comprising Himeko, Welt, Dan Heng, and March 7th
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: "One Big Happy Family" is an expression that typically refers to a group of people who share a close and harmonious relationship, treating each other with love, respect, and support. You the Trailblazer is not a part of this happy family.

achievements.name: Hot-Blooded Trailblazer
achievements.description: Choose hot-blooded dialogue options 5 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Architects (And Former Architects)
achievements.description: Win 1 battle(s) with a team comprising Bronya, Gepard, Pela, and Serval
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Pessimistic Trailblazer
achievements.description: Choose pessimistic dialogue options 5 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts. We provide examples of this dialogue on the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Apologetic Trailblazer
achievements.description: Choose apologetic dialogue options 5 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts. We provide examples of this dialogue on the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Silent Trailblazer
achievements.description: Choose silent dialogue options 5 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts. We provide examples of this dialogue on the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Echoer
achievements.description: Choose repetitive dialogue options 3 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts. We provide examples of this dialogue on the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Meaning of Choice
achievements.description: Choose gender-specific dialogue options 3 time(s)
achievements.comment: Only dialogue during a mission counts. This is extremely rare and frankly the easiest "missable" achievement in the game - we've covered the dialogue options on the HSR Achievement Discord.
achievements.reference: The meaning of choice refers to the act of selecting or making a decision among available options or possibilities.  Everybody and their dog is wondering how to select gender-specific dialogue options.

achievements.name: Lone Wolf
achievements.description: Win 10 battles with only one character on the team
achievements.comment: Easy to achieve in Sim U 1.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: For the Amber Lord
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Preservation
achievements.comment: Impossible to achieve for now, unlockable once Fu Xuan arrives in V1.3
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Ablution Dictum
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Destruction
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Xianzhou Alliance
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of The Hunt
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Meaningless Achievement
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Nihility
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Nihilism is a philosophical belief that all values are baseless and that nothing can be known or communicated. It is often associated with extreme pessimism and a radical skepticism that condemns existence. A true nihilist would believe in nothing, have no loyalties, and no purpose other than, perhaps, an impulse to destroy or farm chives.

achievements.name: The Great Accord
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Harmony
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Knowledge Is Power
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Erudition
achievements.comment: You can borrow a relevant unit from a friend for this achievement. You can run Difficulty 1 in Echo of War without spending stamina (after your 3 weekly runs).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Miracles of Yaoshi
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 characters following the Path of Abundance
achievements.comment: Impossible to achieve for now, unlockable once Lynx arrives in V1.3
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Tempestuous Suppression
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Wind-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: Possible as of V1.2. Remember you can borrow a friend's Wind unit.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Fulguration Beckoner
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Lightning-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Lightning support unit if you're missing one.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Total Conflagration
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Fire-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Fire support unit if you're missing one.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Glacier Dynast
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Ice-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Ice support unit if you're missing one.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Quantum Test
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Quantum-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: Impossible to achieve for now, unlockable once Lynx arrives in V1.3
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Imaginary Law
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Imaginary-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: Impossible to achieve for now, unlockable once Dan Heng IL arrives in V1.3
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Speak with Fists
achievements.description: Win 10 battle(s) with a team that has 4 Physical-Type character(s)
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Physical support unit if you're missing one here.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Life in All Its Forms
achievements.description: Trigger 10 different HP restoration voice lines with Luocha's healing
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Luocha and heal 10 different units. Don't retreat from battle.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Star Saga of the Shattered Sword
achievements.description: Win 1 battle(s) with a team comprising Luocha, Sushang, and Yanqing
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Luocha or Yanqing.
achievements.reference: "Star Saga of the Shattered Sword" is a visual novel in the game Honkai Impact 3rd.

achievements.name: Guardian of the Underworld
achievements.description: Win 1 battle with a team comprising Natasha, Seele, and Luka
achievements.comment: You can use a friend's Seele or Luka for this

achievements.name: Guess Who I Am
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "You Already Know Me"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL22.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Sorrows of Young Arlan
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "An Unexpected Turn of Events"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL12.
achievements.reference: "The Sorrows of Young Werther" is a novel written by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, first published in 1774. It tells the tragic story of a young man named Werther who falls deeply in love with a woman named Charlotte. However, Charlotte is already engaged to another man, and Werther's unrequited love leads him into a state of despair and ultimately, self-destruction.

achievements.name: The Gift of the Magi
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "Hook's Gift"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL24.
achievements.reference:
"The Gift of the Magi" is a short story written by O. Henry, first published in 1905. It tells the story of a young couple, Jim and Della, who are struggling financially but wish to give each other meaningful Christmas gifts. Della has beautiful long hair, and Jim has a prized pocket watch.
In a twist of irony, Della decides to sell her hair to buy a chain for Jim's watch, while Jim sells his watch to buy combs for Della's hair. On Christmas Eve, they exchange their gifts, only to discover that their sacrifices have made their respective gifts useless. Despite the disappointment, the story ends on a heartwarming note as the couple realizes the depth of their love and the true value of their selfless acts.

achievements.name: The Outskirts Here Are Quiet
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "Blizzard Immunity"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL20.
achievements.reference:
"The Dawns Here Are Quiet" is a 1972 Soviet war drama film directed by Stanislav Rostotsky. The film is based on a novel of the same name by Boris Vasilyev and tells the story of a group of female soldiers stationed in a remote area during World War II.
Set in a small Russian village, the film explores the experiences and challenges faced by the women soldiers as they prepare for an imminent German attack. The story focuses on their camaraderie, resilience, and the sacrifices they make in the face of war.

achievements.name: Clara and the Sun
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "Rarely Affectionate"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL34.
achievements.reference: "Klara and the Sun" is a novel written by Kazuo Ishiguro, published in 2021. The story revolves around a young Artificial Friend named Klara, who is designed to serve as a companion to a teenage girl named Josie. The novel explores themes of love, friendship, and the nature of consciousness in an increasingly technologically advanced world.

achievements.name: Serval's Faithfull: An Autobiography
achievements.description: Complete Companion Mission "Only A Child"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL24.
achievements.reference:
"Faithfull: An Autobiography" is the title of Marianne Faithfull's memoir, where she shares her life story and experiences. Marianne Faithfull is a British singer, songwriter, and actress who gained prominence in the 1960s as a prominent figure in the music scene and a muse of the Rolling Stones.
In her autobiography, Faithfull provides a firsthand account of her journey through the music industry, offering insights into her personal life, relationships, and struggles. Kinda sounds like Serval no?

achievements.name: A Perfect Detective
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "A Knight Stranger"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Master Among Swords
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "Frosty Blade's Trial"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Farewell, Punklorde!
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "Punklorde Mentality"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Where Can A Wanderer Rest?
achievements.description: Let Liangmu know the identity of the mara-struck monster in the mission "Evanesce Like the Morning Dew"

achievements.name: For Old Times' Sake
achievements.description: Hide the identity of the mara-struck monster from Liangmu in the mission "Evanesce Like the Morning Dew"
achievements.comment: You can only get one of two achievements from "Evanesce Like the Morning Dew"
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Coffin Dancer
achievements.description: Witness Luocha's hidden side.※ Check the restored recording and listen to Luocha's monologue.
achievements.comment: You get it from completing his companion quest
achievements.reference:
"Coffin Dancer" is a novel written by Jeffery Deaver. It is a popular series of crime novels featuring the forensic detective Lincoln Rhyme.
Lincoln Rhyme, a quadriplegic forensic expert, and his partner, Amelia Sachs, are on the hunt for a ruthless assassin known as the Coffin Dancer. The Coffin Dancer is a professional killer who leaves distinctive clues at his crime scenes, taunting the authorities. No - it's not the Coffin Dance meme.

achievements.name: Soaring Birds and Paper Kites
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "For I Have Touched the Sky"
achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.name: Free Will
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "Letter from a Strange Woman"※ You chose to help Kafka

achievements.name: True Free Will
achievements.description: Complete the Companion Mission "Letter from a Strange Woman"※ You chose to leave Kafka. Not many people would, but this is how you proved your free will
achievements.comment: Are you team Kafka or team true free will? Is free will an illusion? Debate this heavily contested topic on the Completionist Discord.

achievements.name: Seventeen's Map
achievements.description: Find all readable items regarding Asta in the mission "Emptiness of Locus Silentii"
achievements.comment: There are 3 readable items: Talking with Afro man 5 times in the middle of Master Control Zone, Westernmost room of the Storage Zone at the topmost floor, and by defeating a boss top-right of the Base Zone Space Anchor.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Diamond and Rust
achievements.description: Give the log to Bernard in the mission, "To: The Faint Star"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL13.
achievements.reference: "Diamond and Rust" is a song by American folk singer-songwriter Joan Baez. It was released in 1975 as the title track of her album "Diamonds & Rust." The song is a poignant and introspective reflection on past love and memories.

achievements.name: Farewell, Comet Hunter
achievements.description: Collect three "Letters From the Comet Hunter" in the mission "Out of Reach"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Does She Walk Alone?
achievements.description: Complete the mission "Guide Paradox" and witness the android's ending
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Close Encounters of the Sixth Kind
achievements.description: Obtain the ability to communicate with Wubbaboos in the mission "Requiem Mass"
achievements.comment: Unlocked at TL23.
achievements.reference: "Close Encounters of the Sixth Kind" is a phrase that references the classification system for encounters with extraterrestrial beings or UFOs (unidentified flying objects). The classification system was popularized by J. Allen Hynek, a UFO researcher, and astronomer. "Close Encounters of the Sixth Kind" specifically refers to encounters that result in harm or injury to humans. It represents the most severe and unfortunate type of encounter in Hynek's classification system.

achievements.name: Disposable
achievements.description: Find and talk to all Herta puppets in the space station
achievements.comment: There are 6 dolls.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: When Breath Becomes Air
achievements.description: Visit the researcher Eikura Shuu's memorial
achievements.comment: The memorial is found at the Westernmost room of the Storage Zone, at the topmost floor.
achievements.reference: "When Breath Becomes Air" is a memoir written by Paul Kalanithi, a neurosurgeon, and was published posthumously in 2016. The book chronicles Kalanithi's life and his experience facing terminal lung cancer. Kalanithi reflects on his journey from being a medical student with a bright future ahead to becoming a patient facing a life-threatening illness. He explores themes of mortality, identity, purpose, and the meaning of life as he grapples with the profound questions raised by his diagnosis.

achievements.name: Bzzt! Clock Out!
achievements.description: Turn off the little robots in the space station 6 times
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "Bzzt! Clock Out!" is a phrase that suggests the end of a workday or a call to stop working. It can be interpreted as a playful or humorous way of indicating that it's time to finish work, take a break, or disconnect from professional responsibilities.

achievements.name: Door to A New World
achievements.description: Use the Curio "Door to A New World"
achievements.comment: Locate the "Toilet" object in Supply Zone and use it.
achievements.reference: "Door to a New World" is a phrase that may evoke connections to "The Chronicles of Narnia," a popular fantasy book series written by C.S. Lewis. In the series, certain magical wardrobe doors act as portals that transport the characters into the enchanting and mystical land of Narnia.

achievements.name: Just A Number
achievements.description: Use the Curio "Rating Pistol"
achievements.comment: Go to Storage Zone F1 bottom right room and interact with this object.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: No King Rules Forever
achievements.description: Use the Curio "Unbearable Weight" and decipher the contents of the mysterious sound
achievements.comment: Investigate a mysterious voice in the Storage Zone F2 top right room, then go to Storage Zone F1 top right room and investigate the curio.
achievements.reference:
"No king rules forever" is a quote from the video game World of Warcraft, specifically from the expansion pack called "Wrath of the Lich King." In the game's lore, the Lich King is a powerful and imposing figure who seeks to rule over the world of Azeroth with an iron fist.
The quote refers to the ultimate defeat and downfall of the Lich King.

achievements.name: Green Thumb
achievements.description: Talk with the strange plant and visit it again on the next day
achievements.comment: Plant is on the second floor of Base Zone, at the far end. Requires revisiting plant 1 day later.
achievements.reference: "Green thumb" is a phrase used to describe a person who has a natural talent or skill for gardening or taking care of plants. It refers to someone who seems to have a special ability to make plants thrive and grow successfully.

achievements.name: Greed Psychology
achievements.description: Obtain the real treasure in the mission "Survival Wisdom"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: One Day More
achievements.description: Find all of Julian's items in the mission "Hook's Treasure"
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "One Day More" is a phrase that is commonly associated with the musical "Les Misérables." It is a pivotal song in the musical that marks a crucial moment of transition and anticipation. "One Day More" is sung by the ensemble cast as they express their hopes, fears, and aspirations on the eve of a significant event—the uprising against the ruling powers.

achievements.name: Moral Higher Ground
achievements.description: Confront the Public Property Protector and show him the cost of stopping you (or have him humbly acknowledge his wrongdoing.)
achievements.comment: Break a barrel on the east side of Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone and he may appear. Apologize to receive a Praise of High Morals.
achievements.reference: "Moral higher ground" refers to a position of ethical superiority or integrity in a particular situation or context. It suggests that someone or a group of individuals hold a morally superior stance or make decisions based on principles that are considered more virtuous or just. Breaking barrels is your unalienable right and ain't no public property defender is going to stop you.

achievements.name: The Lifecycle of Software Objects
achievements.description: Choose not to format Little Robot in the mission "Rarely Affectionate (Part 2)"

achievements.name: For a Breath I Tarry
achievements.description: Choose to format Little Robot in the mission "Rarely Affectionate (Part 2)"
achievements.comment: You can only get one of two achievements from the Little Robot. Unlocks at TL34.
achievements.reference:
"For a Breath I Tarry" is a phrase that is associated with science fiction author Roger Zelazny's short story of the same name. The story explores themes of artificial intelligence, human consciousness, and the pursuit of understanding life and existence.

"The Lifecycle of Software Objects" is a science fiction novella written by Ted Chiang. It explores the themes of artificial intelligence, consciousness, and the ethical considerations surrounding the creation and development of virtual beings.

achievements.name: Outworlder
achievements.description: Return the music box found in Rivet Town to its heartbroken owner
achievements.comment: Once you have obtained Dirty Ribbon Tied to a Bell, give it to a female voice from the north entrance to Rivet Town. Investigate again to get Damaged Music Box. Submit this box to Anxious Woman in the alleyway southeast of Rivet Town.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: 50 Credits!?
achievements.description: Collect all wanted posters of the Express Crew in Belobog
achievements.comment: 7 wanted posters located in Administrative District.
achievements.reference: Represents One Piece Chopper's first bounty poster, which was 50 belly.

achievements.name: Twinkly, Winkly
achievements.description: Obtain 3 Ancient Coin(s)
achievements.comment: Found in destructible objects in Jarilo-VI, can also be obtained randomly from the Fountain in Administrative District.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Sweet Pom-Pom O'Mine
achievements.description: Try to give the Jarilo-VI's armillary sphere a spin to find... um... Pom-Pom on it?
achievements.comment: Investigate the Armillary Sphere, north of Bronya's desk in Qlipoth Fort. Pick "what is in the northwest".
achievements.reference:
"Sweet Child o' Mine" is a classic rock song by the band Guns N' Roses, released in 1987. It is known for its memorable guitar riff, powerful vocals, and heartfelt lyrics.
The song explores themes of love, longing, and the complexities of relationships. It is often interpreted as a tribute to a special person in the singer's life, expressing feelings of affection, admiration, and a desire for a deep and meaningful connection.

achievements.name: Hurt Locker
achievements.description: Solve the crisis at the Belobog cable car station while also avoiding ethical risks
achievements.comment: Interact with a ticking suitcase near cable car in Administrative District. You may need a Praise of High Morals.
achievements.reference: "Hurt Locker" is a title that is often associated with the 2008 war film directed by Kathryn Bigelow. The phrase itself refers to a literal term used to describe a place or situation where there is a high risk of injury or danger, particularly in the context of military operations involving explosive devices. "Hurt Locker" has been adopted more broadly to refer to any situation or environment that is fraught with danger, risk, or intense pressure, like opening an unidentified ticking suitcase.

achievements.name: Where It All Began
achievements.description: Return to the room where the Stellaron was kept and recall a blurred memory
achievements.comment: Go to the Storage Zone, F1 bottom right (fast travel to Gallery of Shadow).
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Knight in Shining Armor
achievements.description: Find the language module and give it to Fidora the amateur mechanic
achievements.comment: Buy the Language Module from Ronald in Administrative District, and give it to Fidora near the Goethe Grand Hotel.
achievements.reference: "Knight in Shining Armor" is a popular phrase and concept that originates from medieval folklore and chivalric tales. It refers to a heroic and gallant figure, typically a knight, who is portrayed as brave, honorable, and virtuous.

achievements.name: Honest Abe
achievements.description: Pass the test of integrity set up by a mysterious researcher
achievements.comment: Go to Storage Zone F2's Special Purpose Lab, interact with giant square in the center. Purposely lie three times here to possibly unlock another achievement "The Echoer", and then finally pick the 3rd option. This is an un-missable achievement.
achievements.reference: "Honest Abe" is a nickname for the 16th President of the United States, Abraham Lincoln. It highlights Lincoln's reputation for honesty, integrity, and moral character.

achievements.name: The Mandela Effect
achievements.description: Contact Belobog's "back alley"
achievements.comment: Interact with man behind a locked gate in the Administrative District, past Tamila four times. Exit and re-enter this map for the man to re-appear after every interaction. For the last interaction, you probably need to complete Trailblaze Mission Young Guard.
achievements.reference: The Mandela Effect refers to a phenomenon in which a large number of people remember a particular event, fact, or detail differently from the documented evidence or reality. The Mandela Effect suggests that collective false memories can emerge, leading people to believe in alternative versions of past events or details that do not align with factual records.

achievements.name: Natural Immunity
achievements.description: Obtain the recipe for fried rice from talking with Gertie at the Goethe Grand Hotel
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Lā Lá Lǎ Là Land
achievements.description: Obtain the score for the phonograph from talking with Tamila at the Golden Theater
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "La La Land" is a 2016 musical film directed by Damien Chazelle that received critical acclaim and achieved significant popularity in pop culture. The film tells the story of Mia, an aspiring actress, and Sebastian, a dedicated jazz musician, as they navigate their dreams and love in the bustling city of Los Angeles.

achievements.name: Winter City Trap
achievements.description: Finish listening to the vagrant's rap
achievements.comment: Located in Jarilo-VI, Robot Settlement, Vagrant Camp
achievements.reference: "Winter City Trap" is a phrase that combines elements of winter imagery with the musical genre of trap, specifically within the context of rap music. It suggests a fusion of urban culture, cold weather aesthetics, and the energetic and gritty sound of trap music.

achievements.name: For Ages 12 and Up
achievements.description: Participate in the Dark Fist Tournament and become the ultimate winner
achievements.comment: Obtain the Dark Fist Tournament Invitation Letter in the Fight Club, then talk to some kid right ouside and win against them. You're guaranteed to win 2/3 regardless of choices you make.
achievements.reference: "For Ages 12 and Up" is a label commonly found on various forms of media, including books, movies, video games, and other entertainment content. It serves as an indication that the particular media is suitable for individuals who are 12 years old and older, taking into account the content's themes, complexity, and potentially mature elements.

achievements.name: Dance Like A Butterfly, Sting Like A Bee
achievements.description: Dominate all 5 tournaments in the Boulder Town Super League
achievements.comment: Just beat the event, takes 5 days. This is a permanent event.
achievements.reference: "Dance like a butterfly, sting like a bee" is a phrase famously associated with the boxing legend Muhammad Ali. It captures Ali's unique approach to boxing, combining gracefulness and agility with powerful and precise strikes.

achievements.name: The Kelly Gang
achievements.description: Excavate the treasure hidden in the Belobog Administrative District's fountain
achievements.comment: Interact with the Fountain in the Administrative District and submit 1 Praise of High Morals.
achievements.reference: The Kelly Gang refers to a notorious group of outlaws led by the Australian bushranger Ned Kelly during the late 19th century. The gang, consisting of Ned Kelly and his associates, gained notoriety for their criminal activities, which included robbery, horse theft, and confrontations with law enforcement. According to some stories, the gang supposedly amassed a hidden treasure through their criminal exploits, and its location has become a subject of fascination and speculation.

achievements.name: The Banality of Evil
achievements.description: Finish all the Fool's Box puzzles in the mission "Vessel of Mediocrity"
achievements.comment: Last quest unlocks at TL24.
achievements.reference: "The Banality of Evil" is a phrase coined by philosopher Hannah Arendt to describe her observations during the trial of Adolf Eichmann, a high-ranking Nazi official responsible for organizing the transportation of Jews to concentration camps during World War II. Arendt argued that Eichmann's actions and the evil he facilitated were not driven by extreme malice or sadism, but rather by a bureaucratic and thoughtless adherence to his assigned duties.

achievements.name: The Fourth Little Mole
achievements.description: Find all hidden treasures in the Mission "The Adventurous Moles"
achievements.comment: Reach TL24.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Adventurous Moles Super Grown-Up Edition
achievements.description: Buy The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure from the Belobog Book Merchant
achievements.comment: Achievement fixed as of V1.1.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Draconic Opulence
achievements.description: Witness Dan Shu's story
achievements.comment: Draconic Opulence... (This category changed from Rail Unto the Stars to The Memories We Share as of V1.2). If you Abandon the "Sinners Misled, Credence Falsified" quest and go straight into "Crossroads of Fate", you'll receive the Friend of the Cloud Knights achievement instead.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Friend of the Cloud Knights
achievements.description: Fulfill the General's orders without distractions

achievements.name: Free For Today
achievements.description: Open up the general exhibition area of the Belobog History and Culture Museum
achievements.comment: You will naturally obtain this achievement from completing the entire Belobog Museum quest.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Catch Me If You Can
achievements.description: Open up three exhibition areas in the Belobog History and Culture Museum
achievements.comment: The true unlock condition is to complete all 4 quests in the questline "Opportunity Makes the Thief"
achievements.reference: "Catch Me If You Can" is a pop culture reference commonly associated with the title of a book and subsequent film released in 2002. The story is based on the real-life experiences of Frank Abagnale Jr., a former con artist and impostor who successfully assumed various identities and committed numerous fraudulent acts before being apprehended by the authorities.

achievements.name: You Should Stay in the Museum!
achievements.description: Collect all display items for the Belobog History and Culture Museum
achievements.comment: You will naturally obtain this achievement from completing the entire Belobog Museum quest.
achievements.reference:
The iconic quote associated with Indiana Jones is "This belongs in a museum!" It is a line frequently spoken by Indiana Jones throughout the film series, typically when he encounters valuable historical artifacts or important cultural relics.
The phrase reflects Indiana Jones' dedication to preserving history and ensuring that significant artifacts are studied, protected, and shared with the world. Contrary to popular beliefs, Ezreal from LoL is not the originator of the quote.

achievements.name: A Simple Life
achievements.description: Receive a text from Luhui after completing the mission "Fired"
achievements.comment: Last quest unlocks at TL30.
achievements.reference:
"A Simple Life" is a 2011 Hong Kong drama film directed by Ann Hui. The film tells the story of a young man named Roger, who develops a close relationship with his family's elderly maid, Ah Tao. As Ah Tao's health deteriorates, Roger becomes her primary caregiver, and they navigate the challenges and joys of their intergenerational bond.
The film received critical acclaim and won numerous awards for its heartfelt storytelling and poignant exploration of human connections.

achievements.name: Carpe Diem, Festina Lente, and Tempus Fugit
achievements.description: Revving up, Losing Steam and Running On Empty.Receive all the texts about Chengjie's fading passion after completing the mission "A Teacher and a Friend"
achievements.comment: Last quest unlocks at TL36.
achievements.reference: "Carpe Diem," "Festina Lente," and "Tempus Fugit" are all Latin phrases that have become well-known in popular culture. These phrases have been widely used in various forms of art, literature, music, and other cultural contexts. They have become popular mottos and philosophical principles, reminding people of the value of embracing the present, acting purposefully, and being aware of the passage of time.

achievements.name: Cyber Fraud
achievements.description: Choose to have the Foxian Beauty turn themselves in during the mission "From Xianzhou With Love"

achievements.name: Tootsie
achievements.description: Choose to have the Foxian Beauty reveal their true identity during the mission "From Xianzhou With Love"
achievements.comment: You can only get one of the three achievements from Foxian Beauty. Quest unlocks at TL38.
achievements.reference:
"Tootsie" is a popular American comedy film starring Dustin Hoffman. In the movie, Hoffman's character is an actor who, failing to get roles as a man, decides to pose as a woman and becomes a star, just like the Foxian beauty.

"Cyber Fraud" is often used as a plot device to explore themes of identity, privacy, and the power of technology. It also reflects real-world fears and anxieties about the potential misuse of our increasingly connected digital world.

Shiseido's Majolica Majorca cosmetic line introduced the tagline "A Secret Makes a Woman, Woman" in their 2003 ad campaign. This phrase sought to encapsulate the allure and mystique often linked with femininity and beauty. The game cleverly adapts this tagline, implying that the player's task of concealing a secret is essential for maintaining the Foxian Beauty's perceived femininity.

achievements.name: A Secret Makes a Woman, Woman.
achievements.description: Choose to let the Foxian Beauty continue the ruse during the mission "From Xianzhou With Love"

achievements.name: The Seven Errors of Cycranes: Sloth
achievements.description: Convince the depressed cycrane to return to its job
achievements.comment: Located top-right in Central Starskiff Haven. This is the first Cycrane mini quest that triggers the rest of the mini quests.
achievements.reference: "The Seven Errors of Cycranes: Sloth" is a phrase that combines elements of fantasy or mythology with the concept of the Seven Deadly Sins, specifically focusing on the sin of sloth.

achievements.name: Seven Birds in the Hand Is Worth A Thousand in the Bush
achievements.description: Help Heron Express to recover all lost cycranes
achievements.comment: There are seven of them. Final achievement is gated behind beating the Deer in the main story.
achievements.reference:
The phrase is a variation of the popular saying "A Bird in the Hand Is Worth Two in the Bush." The original saying implies that it is better to hold onto something you already have, rather than risk losing it by pursuing something uncertain or potentially greater.
The modified version exaggerates the idea of keeping what you already have, suggesting that the value of having a sure thing is far greater than the potential benefits of seeking greater rewards that are uncertain or difficult to obtain.

achievements.name: Fair and Square
achievements.description: Win the Xianzhou Luofu Competitive Eater Championship openly and fairly
achievements.comment: You can only get one of the three achievements from Xianzhou Luofu Competitive Eater Championship.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: All Is Fair in Love and War
achievements.description: Win the Xianzhou Luofu Competitive Eater Championship in underhanded ways

achievements.name: From Hero to Zero
achievements.description: Lose the Xianzhou Luofu Competitive Eater Championship

achievements.name: Far From the Madding Crowd
achievements.description: Talk with the Immortal in a Vase and obtain its gift from the vase
achievements.comment: You can only get one of two achievements from the Immortal in a Vase. Find it in the Exalting Sanctum, east of Realm-Keeping Commission Chancery and attack it to trigger dialogue. Then come back a day later to get achievement.
achievements.reference: "Far from the Madding Crowd" is a phrase that originates from a poem by Thomas Gray called "Elegy Written in a Country Churchyard" (1751). It refers to being removed or distant from the stresses, chaos, or hustle and bustle of public life, particularly in an urban setting. The phrase suggests a longing for peace, tranquility, and solitude.

achievements.name: Let the Wind Blow Where It May
achievements.description: Talk with the Immortal in a Vase and refuse its gift

achievements.name: Hasta la vista, Hexanexus!
achievements.description: Complete 15 Hexanexus challenge(s) from the Hex Club
achievements.comment: It's actually 16 puzzles. Talk to NPC in artisanship commission and do the diamond puzzle.
achievements.reference:
The phrase combines the famous line "Hasta la vista, baby!" from the movie Terminator 2: Judgment Day with the word "Hexanexus."
In Terminator 2 the character played by Arnold Schwarzenegger, utters the line "Hasta la vista, baby!" before eliminating a threat. It has become an iconic catchphrase associated with the Terminator franchise and is often used playfully or humorously in pop culture.

achievements.name: Rubik's Headache

achievements.comment: Unlocked after completing the previous 15.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Labor Omnia Vincit

achievements.comment: Available as of V1.1. Interact with the 3 file cabinets.
achievements.reference: "Labor Omnia Vincit" is a Latin phrase that translates to "Work conquers all" in English. It expresses the idea that hard work, effort, and diligence are essential for achieving success and overcoming obstacles. Early chive hunters will remember how often they had tried to "interact" with the file cabinets.

It seems to be a play on "open world," a type of video game design that allows players to roam a virtual world at will as opposed to a world with more linear and structured gameplay.
The term "Unopen World" might imply a game design that limits player freedom or a world that has yet to be explored or "opened" in the gaming context, like Honkai Star Rail.

achievements.reference: The phrase "But at what cost?" raises an important question regarding the potential consequences or sacrifices associated with certain actions or pursuits. It prompts us to consider the trade-offs involved and evaluate whether the benefits or desired outcomes are worth the potential drawbacks or negative repercussions. It is also a popular internet meme. ("I've won... but at what cost?").

It serves as a preliminary plan or roadmap for conducting the research and is typically submitted to a university or academic committee for approval before the actual dissertation writing process begins.

While "Pulp Fiction" refers to a genre of popular and often sensationalist storytelling, "Non-pulp Fiction" suggests a departure from that style or a story that falls outside the typical characteristics of pulp fiction.

achievements.name: Inter-Domain Roaming

achievements.reference: "Inter-Domain Roaming" refers to the ability of a device or user to move seamlessly between different domains or networks while maintaining connectivity and access to services. It typically applies to wireless communication technologies such as Wi-Fi or cellular networks.

achievements.comment: You can repeat any mission in the Silverman Guard Restricted Zone (An Eye for an Eye, or Winter Soldiers' March) or (Signs of Fragmentum) in the Storage Zone for this.

achievements.reference:
"Tindalos" may be a reference to the mythical creatures known as Tindalos Hounds or Tindalos Beasts. These creatures originate from the writings of H.P. Lovecraft, particularly his story "The Whisperer in Darkness." Tindalos Hounds are said to be extradimensional beings that hunt individuals who have violated certain cosmic laws or engaged in forbidden rituals.
Combining these two elements, "Tindalos Piggy" represents an interdimensional pig.

achievements.comment: No comment

achievements.comment: There are 20 memory bubbles.

achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: The Seven-Bridges Problem
achievements.description: Find all repulsion bridge treasures
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: The Seven Bridges of Königsberg is a famous mathematical problem that originated in the city of Königsberg (now Kaliningrad, Russia) in the 18th century. The problem involves a network of seven bridges connecting different land masses and islands across the Pregel River. The challenge was to find a path that would allow someone to cross each bridge exactly once and return to the starting point.

achievements.name: The Birth of Tragedy
achievements.description: Find all of The Fool's Box treasures
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "The Birth of Tragedy" is a philosophical work written by Friedrich Nietzsche, a prominent German philosopher. Published in 1872, the book explores the origins and nature of Greek tragedy and its relevance to the modern world. "The Birth of Tragedy" has had a significant influence on various fields, including philosophy, literature, and art. It challenges traditional notions of aesthetics, explores the interplay between reason and emotion, and raises questions about the nature of human existence and the role of art in society.

achievements.name: Sisyphus of the Mines
achievements.description: Complete the final Mine Cart Test
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: "Sisyphus of the Mines" is a phrase that combines the Greek mythological figure Sisyphus with the concept of mines. Sisyphus is known for his punishment in the underworld, where he was condemned to roll a heavy boulder up a hill, only to have it roll back down, forcing him to repeat the task for eternity. I guess completing the mine cart was supposed to be a waste of time, but at least we got rewarded with jades.

achievements.name: The Tale of Moles

achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: Red to Red and White to White
achievements.description: Complete Magflow Link 10 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference:
"Red to red and white to white" is a common phrase used in the context of boating and navigation, referring to the color of navigation lights on boats. The rule of "red to red and white to white" means that you are in a safe position if you see the other vessel's red light on your right (starboard) and its green light on your left (port), indicating that the vessel is moving from your right to left. If you see both the red and green light in front of you, the vessel is heading directly towards you, and it is not safe.

Similarly, "white to white" means seeing both the stern (rear) and masthead (front) white lights of a vessel, indicating it is moving away from you.

In the context of the game, the magflow link has red light when incomplete and white when completed.

achievements.name: Don't You Dare Waste It

achievements.comment: In the Administrative District.
achievements.reference: Missing or no specific reference.

achievements.name: A Metaphor of Caves
achievements.description: Complete the Hexanexus 30 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference: The "Allegory of the Cave" is a famous philosophical concept presented by the ancient Greek philosopher Plato in his work "The Republic." It is a metaphorical story that illustrates Plato's ideas about the nature of knowledge, and the importance of critical thinking and self-reflection in the quest for truth and enlightenment.

achievements.name: North by Northwest
achievements.description: Complete the Navigation Compass 20 time(s)
achievements.comment: No comment
achievements.reference:
"North by Northwest" is a classic suspense thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock and released in 1959. The title itself is a combination of cardinal directions and represents the protagonist's journey and the sense of suspense and danger he experiences throughout the story.
The title is not meant to be interpreted literally, as it doesn't refer to a specific direction or geographic location. Instead, it adds to the overall sense of mystery and intrigue, emphasizing the unpredictable nature of the portagonist's journey.
